([[Valletta]], [[Malta]]; 20 February 2009) | Largest loss = {{Flagicon|Portugal}} [[Portugal national futsal team|Portugal]] 18-6 {{flagicon|Albania}} Albania
([[Braga]], [[Portugal]]; 8 November 2003) | World cup apps = 0 | World cup first = | World cup best = | Regional name = [[UEFA Futsal Championship]] | Regional cup apps = 0 | Regional cup first = | Regional cup best = }} The '''Albanian national futsal team''' represents [[Albania]] in international [[futsal]] competitions and is controlled by the Albanian Football Federation. The team debuted in the 2005 UEFA Futsal Championship. They won the first match 8â6 against England, and they drew to Cyprus, but failed to qualify because of the goal difference. In the [[2008 FIFA Futsal World Cup]], Albania, was drawn against Slovenia, Greece, and Malta. They ended up in second place winning two matches and losing only one. In the end Slovenia qualified for the finals. In the [[2007 UEFA Futsal Championship]], Albania made a bad performance by losing all matches and finishing last in group. ==Competition History== ===[[FIFA Futsal World Cup|FIFA World Cup]]=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;font-size:90%;" |- !colspan=8|[[FIFA Futsal World Cup|FIFA World Cup Record]] |- !width=125|Year !width=150|Round !width=35|Pld !width=35|W !width=35|D !width=35|L !width=35|GS !width=35|GA |- |{{flagicon|BRA}} [[2008 FIFA Futsal World Cup|2008]]||''Did not qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |{{flagicon|THA}} [[2012 FIFA Futsal World Cup|2012]]||''Did not qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||- |- !'''Total'''||0/2||-||-||-||-||-||- |} ===[[UEFA European Futsal Championship]]=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;font-size:90%;" |- !colspan=8|[[UEFA European Futsal Championship|UEFA European Futsal Championship Record]] |- !width=125|Year !width=150|Round !width=35|Pld !width=35|W !width=35|D !width=35|L !width=35|GS !width=35|GA |- |{{flagicon|CZE}} [[UEFA European Futsal Championship 2005|2005]]||''Did not qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |{{flagicon|POR}} [[UEFA European Futsal Championship 2007|2007]]||''Did not qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |{{flagicon|HUN}} [[UEFA European Futsal Championship 2010|2010]]||''Did not qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |{{flagicon|CRO}} [[2012 UEFA Futsal Championship|2012]]||''Did not qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||- |- !'''Total'''||0/4||-||-||-||-||-||- |} == Current squad == {{National football squad start (goals)}} {{National football squad player (goals)|no=12|pos=GK|name=Armand Nebiu|age={{Birth date and age|1983|11|15}}|caps=6|goals=0|club=[[Futsal Klub Tirana]]|clubnat=ALB}} {{National football squad player (goals)|no=1|pos=GK|name=Klodian Rrapi|age={{Birth date and age|1983|8|27}}|caps=3|goals=0|club=Edro VlorÃ«|clubnat=ALB}} |- ! colspan="9" style="background:#b0d3fb;
